fields.description:
As of now, under _Configure Board > Estimate_ it's possible to select a field that isn't configured for Issues included in the board. It would be good if Agile checked whether the field is available in Projects included in the board and displayed an information if that isn't the case.

+Example:+ Business Value field is only configured for Project A, but can still be selected as the estimate for a board created for Project B. No warning will show, the estimate tooltips for any of the Issues just won't be displayed.
fields.summary: A warning should be displayed when estimation field is unavailable

fields.description:
If a story has a sub-task that matches a quick filter that story will appear on the work board. If you switch to the story board though and use the quick filter the same story won't appear. This is because sub-tasks don't appear on the plan board.

Even though sub-tasks shouldn't appear on the plan board it should be possible to view the parents of those tasks if any of the sub-tasks are valid under a quick filter.
fields.summary: Quick filter on plan board should show issues with sub-tasks that match query

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

On the Work board, when dragging an issue to a column with multiple statuses, the candidate statuses are shown when hovering over the column. This is good, because I know what will happen to this issue.

Unfortunately, this breaks when the issue cannot be transitioned to some of the statuses of the column: If there is only one target status left, that status is no longer shown. In this case, it is incredibly hard to predict to which status the item will transition to. E.g. in our fairly normal workflow, it is for example not possible to stop progress on an item which you are not assigned to. 

The customers would want to be able to transition the issues over the workflow using board without the need to have in mind a complex workflow.

h3. Suggested Solution
A workaround is to pick a workflow which allows all transitions (or even using the Jira Agile Simplified Workflow), but since our "global issue tracking project" is centrally managed, this is not something I can influence.

So, I'd expect that the target status is always shown when dragging items to a column with multiple statuses. Optionally, the target statuses could also simply always be shown. Another option would be to also show statues to which one cannot transition (e.g. in red) and display an explanation if someone should drop the item there.
fields.summary: Always show target status when dragging issues on Board to a column with multiple statuses

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10460].
  {panel}

Sprint field displays 'None' on view issue and issue navigator when an issue is only in completed sprints

*Steps to Reproduce*
* Create a sprint, with issues from the board backlog
* Complete the sprint

*Results*
* The sprint field value is displayed as 'none' for all the issues in the completed sprint, as long as the issue belongs to no other active sprint.

*Symptoms*
If you search for issues using the JQL below:
{noformat}
Sprint is not empty
{noformat}

There are results displayed with Sprint = None:
!SprintFieldIsNone_1.png|width=100%!

If we open one of such issues, we can see that although the field Sprint is None, the Agile section displays that the issue belonged to a sprint which was completed:
!SprintFieldIsNone_2.png|width=100%!

*Expected result:*
The sprint field should display the sprint in which the issue was included.
fields.summary: The Sprint field is none even though it is not empty

fields.description: This doesn't give me much confidence that the source download matches the GA binary download.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile 6.3.9 source download has version 6.3.10-SNAPSHOT in the pom

fields.description:
On the JIRA test cluster, I saw the following message:

bq. JIRA Agile is currently unavailable. This might be because an upgrade task has failed to run or has not not yet completed.

The bug is that the word "not" is duplicated in the above message.
fields.summary: Duplicate word in error message about incomplete upgrade task

fields.description: In the Agile Rapidboard Planning screen, currently the original time estimate is shown with each story and is misleading when planning sprints.  I would expect the Planning board to provide the sum of remaining estimates (including both the parent and technical task estimates) for "each" story.  See attached screenshot for clarification.
fields.summary: Show Sum of Remaining Estimate for Each Story in Planning Board

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like to be able to rapidly re-sort the scrum board based on epic, assignee, story point estimates, issue updated date and so on. Currently, the only option is swimlanes, which are fixed for a given board and affect everyone.

I would also like to see a total at the top for each scrum board column, which is helpful when the number of issues in a column becomes longer than a page.
fields.summary: sorting instead of swimlanes
As a administrator, I'd like to add an Estimate column in the plan mode
JIRA agile not working for https://scadaminds.atlassian.net
REST representation bug for "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:greenhopper-releasedmultiversionhistory"

fields.description:
h5. Overview
As of now, the *Report Mode* only provides the following reports which are listed in the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Report+Mode]. Since JIRA Agile itself is a plugin, there is no other plugin that can extend the various types of reports.

h5. Suggestion for a new report
For sprint X which will be completing in next _40 hours_, the user should see allocated time for the team users & lets say user A has issues with original estimation time with more than _40 hours_ then that user must highlighted or some icon comes as RED stating this users is heavy allocated. So, the scrum master can move some of A user task to other available user.
fields.summary: JIRA Agile Report extension (from the default Report Mode)

fields.description:
Doubtless this has been requested before, but I can't see it.

Using the Plan screen to manage the backlog is currently quite limiting, and causes my product owners a lot of work.  They often have 2-300 items in their backlogs, from multiple clients, and it is tedious finding items to change rank, add to sprints, etc.

What I would like to see is *display of additional sortable columns on the backlog (status, created, last edited)* so that you can find items more easily, and add them to a sprint
fields.summary: As a Product Owner I want to view and sort my backlog by different fields
Statuses available for mapping are not taking into account statuses applicable to sub-tasks in my workflow
fffff

fields.description:
At least in our workflow, one of the most common actions while in Agile board view, is to take assignment of an unassigned story or task.  Currently this requires a minimum of 5 clicks:
1. Click the issue number link on the story/task in it's column (usually on the left-hand side)
2. Click the "..." additional options menu at the top of the task view pane (on the right hand side)
3. Click the "Assign" link from the menu
4. Click "Assign to me" on the assignment modal (in the middle of the screen)
5. Click the "Assign" button on the bottom of the assignment modal.
At this point, you then have to go back and re-find (eye-movement/scannning) the original issue you were dealing with.

Request/Recommended Solution.
On the agile card for a story/task that is unassigned, in the spot where an assigned task would display the assigned users's avatar, if the current user has permission to take assignment, place an arrow/checkmark or other graphical indicator with a title/help text of "Take assignment" (possibly displaying current user's avatar in the spot on long hover)  Clicking this icon should immediately modify the task/story to be assigned to the current user and the action icon should be replaced with the current user's avatar.  This way user's eye never has to move from the story they are working with for the most common assignment action.

See attached mock-up.
fields.summary: Add Quick "Take Assignment" link to cards that are unassigned in the agile board view

fields.description:
As an admin, I want to set a default template that all newly created Agile boards follow so that I can avoid having to configure boards manually each time.

As an example, our company uses a 4 column layout for Agile boards so that we can differentiate between *Resolved* and *Closed* Stories. Every time I create an Agile board for a project, I have to change it to have 4 columns, change the default filter, setup the same quick filters and make other small configuration options that are consistent across all projects. I would like to be able to change the default setup (or create a new template board) that can be used for all new Agile boards.
fields.summary: Allow for Project Templates to be available in JIRA Agile

fields.description:
We will support several agile projects in our organization in the following months. We would need a general setting for non-working days or maybe a default setting (like a template copied at project creation) that individual teams could edit according to their own work schedule.

Also we would need a way to batch-add new holidays as we might have some long running projects spanning over years.

In the meantime, is there some groovy script or any other workaround to add a holiday to all projects using Jira Agile?
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin I have to set non-working days for several projects

fields.description:
To be set in the Agile's global configuration.
To add in the show menu condition.

----
I have a number of contractors who use our JIRA instance for very specific projects. I don’t want them to see the Agile menu (nor Tempo or other plug-in's ). They need have a very strict workflow and very very limited permissions. I don’t want them to play around in Agile.

It would be nice to be able to say: only this group can even see the Agile menu.
fields.summary: As a JIRA administrator I would like to be able to restrict the use of AGILE to specific jira-groups

fields.description: When an issue is in a column with multiple statuses, we can't change it from one status to another while within the same work column on the board.
fields.summary: Transitioning an Issue in the same column

fields.description:
Jaws screen reading software does not change the keyboard navigation and as such user cannot access any of the menus in JIRA Agile. There are some hotkeys but not for all features

Specific to the scrum boards user have to navigate with the keyboard top to bottom left to right. This means that to be able to read the description of an item in the scrum board, the user have to first read the entire backlog start to finish. Then to go to the next item have to keyboard navigate back to where was and repeat the process. This means hundreds of keystrokes to accomplish the task of reading the description of one item.

Referral links:
Jaws screen reader: http://www.freedomscientific.com/products/fs/jaws-product-page.asp
Accessibility Standards: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_Content_Accessibility_Guidelines
fields.summary: Vision Impaired User unable to use Jira Agile Boards with screen reading software

fields.description:
Has there been any consideration with have the Issues without epics/versions listed at the top along with All Issues?

In larger versions/epics lists, trying to check for the items without those defined would need you to scroll to the very bottom of the list. 

A workaround is to create a quick filter, but it seems redundant. 

*Workaround*: Create quick filters to sort the lists when you're viewing All issues
fields.summary: Issues without epics/versions listed on top

fields.description:
Sprint report will show all old sprints in the drop down, and currently the solution is to bulk edit all issues in that sprint to remove them, however if issues had been in previous sprints for planning purposes, those will still show up in the sprint report list.

To confirm, you can use JQL to search Sprint in (Sprint X), which will return 0 issues, but on the Sprint Report, Sprint X still shows up in the drop down.  Clicking the link to show the issues in that sprint will return all issues that were ever associated with that sprint.
fields.summary: Allow old sprints to be removed from report drop downs

fields.description:
It makes sense as to why most of the JIRA Agile fields are locked, there is no reason for people to mess with their configuration as they are internal to JIRA Agile.  

Epic Link, however, is not.  It is a field that is placed on screens for the convenience of linking issues to Epics, it has nothing to do with how Epics work.  This field should be able to participate in Field Configurations without having to go through extra steps (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GHKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field).
fields.summary: Epic Link Should be Unlocked by Default

fields.description:
h5. Overview
As we can see in the following screen shot below, JIRA Agile only allows a single issue to be displayed on a single line in a column:
!demo_board.JPG|thumbnail!

As the size of the board grows bigger, users will have to scroll all the way down to view more issues. Imagine if the user has more than 1000 issues in a single board, it will be really tiring.

h5. Suggestion
If we can have the configuration to have maybe 2 or 3 issues to be displayed on a single line in the board, it might make it easier. Imagine that the 1000 lines can be cut down into 500. That can save a lot of time.

Perhaps the size of the card can be reduced to have 2 issues to be displayed side by side. That can be a good idea as a start.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile Board Owner, I would like to have the ability to configure more issues to be displayed in a single line in Work Mode

fields.description:
The language in which JIRA Agile custom fields are created is the default JIRA language (not Java locale) at the time of *first* installation of JIRA Agile. Since the custom fields are locked, these cannot be changed other than using the workaround in [GHS-10356|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-10356], which is a request for JIRA Agile to support i18n.

Could you kindly mention about this language setting in [JIRA Agile Installation and Upgrade Guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/JIRA+Agile+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide]?
fields.summary: Language in which JIRA Agile is installed

fields.description:
This is a follow-up to GHS-4802, which was closed, but not really addressed in my opinion.

We are using Jira and Jira Agile. Our users are asking for the ability of Jira gadgets to support showing data in terms of story points instead of issue counts. For example, for whatever statistic type is chosen for a Pie Chart gadget, we would like the ability to show the total story points for each type instead of issue counts. Or for the Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, there should be an option to show the data in terms of story points instead of issue counts. The idea is to show data in terms of a story point budget.

In Jira Agile, even if the estimation statistic for a board is set to Story Points, there's no agile report that can show the data we're looking for. This should have nothing to to with classic boards, which I understand that Atlassian is de-supporting.
fields.summary: allow gadgets to show statistics using story points instead of issue counts

fields.description:
As a large enterprise user, we require the ability for our developers to provide their capacity (in hours) for each sprint so that the Scrum Master can easily create a sprint and assign stories without needing to confirm with each dev on each issue if they will have time for it.

Overall, JIRA Agile (formerly GreenHopper) is better and more efficient than previously used agile tools such as Rally, save for this one lacking feature.
fields.summary: As an enterprise agile user, I would like to be able to do developer capacity planning on Scrum boards

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Click on _Linked Pages_ -> Create Page

h3. What happens

fields.description:
1. Created a new filter https://channeliq.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=13513
2. Click "Advanced"
3. Take the query string [project in (SFRE, CM) ORDER BY Rank ASC] and change it to [project in (SFRE, CM) AND "Epic Link" = SFRE-1 Rank ASC]

Expected: "Save As" changes to "Save", and clicking "Save" saves the criteria
Actual: Remains "Save As"

1. Go back to "Basic"
2. Add some other criteria: Status - On Deck ("Save As" changes to "Save")
3. Click "Advanced"
4. Change query string [project in (SFRE, CM) AND status = OnDeck ORDER BY Rank ASC] to [project in (SFRE, CM) AND "Epic Link" = SFRE-1 ORDER BY Rank ASC]
5. Click "Save"
6. Click "Basic"

Expected: Criteria includes "Epic Link" = SFRE-1
Actual: Criteria does not include "Epic Link", but still includes OnDeck
fields.summary: Adding Epic Link to Filter will not save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10411].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Download and install from scratch JIRA 6.2 (release candidate or final)
# Click the "Agile" top level menu item
## This will prompt the user to "Try JIRA Agile"
## Follow the prompts to download and install the plugin
## Do *not* enter my.atlassian.com credentials and close the dialog or refresh the page

OR

# Download and install from scratch JIRA 6.2 (release candidate or final)
# Install JIRA Agile plugin manually (either via UPM or installed-plugins directory)
# Do *not* license JIRA Agile in any way

h3. Symptoms

* For JIRA Administrators, two "Agile" top level menu items appear in the navigation bar.
** One will direct the user to UPM to enter a license for JIRA Agile
** The other will open the dialog which prompts the admin to "Try JIRA Agile"

h3. Work-around

Any of these options should work:
* Disable the *JIRA Agile Marketing Plugin* via UPM
* Disable the {{gha-od-menu-item}} web-item plugin module inside the JIRA Agile Marketing Plugin via UPM
* License JIRA Agile (an evaluation license will suffice)
* Each administrator can "dismiss" the "Try JIRA Agile" dialog and it will not show again.
fields.summary: Two Agile menus visible in JIRA 6.2 BTF

fields.summary: Issues tab gives: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException

fields.description:
The % complete bar calculation on epics seems to be conceptionally wrong.

% Complete (Work Ratio) = Time Spent / Original Time Estimate 

Is what it seems to be tracking... which is really a "Work Ratio" calculation versus a % Complete formula. Wouldn't this be better:

% Complete = Time Spent / (Time Remaining + Time Spent)

Also it would be great if the epic report would project a target completion date like the Version report does.
fields.summary: % Complete Bar on Epics

fields.description:
* Client has requested to have a "create issue" button right within the sprint that would allow the issue to automatically be created within the sprint.
*  This would be instead of the "Create Issue" button at the top of the page being generated by JIRA.
fields.summary: Quick Create Issue Button in Agile Sprint

fields.description:
h5. Background
As of now, the [Report mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Report+Mode] in JIRA Agile shows the *Status Report* section (excluding Burndown Chart) as the following:
* Completed Issues
* Incomplete Issues

!version_report.JPG|thumbnail!

This explains why the progress of the reports (Sprint. Version, and Epic) are tracked by the two options, either the issue is resolved / completed or it is not (not by the actual progress of the issue)

Unlike Burndown Chart, it shows the complete progress of each issue that belongs the particular sprint, allowing users to track the changes in the Estimation:
!burndown_chart.JPG|thumbnail!

The _Remaining Estimate and Time Spent_ in *Time Tracking* will only be taken into consideration for [Burndown Chart|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Burndown+Chart] only.
!estimation.JPG|thumbnail!

h5. Expectation
How the reports should work is that:
* The Version and Epic reports should reflect the _Remaining Estimate_. Why? Because the [estimated amount of work remaining|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Version+Report] is directly provided in the Remaining Estimate.
* The progress shown in the Version and Epic in the Plan mode reflects the _Remaining Estimate_ of the associated issues.
* The Sprint report shows the _Remaining Estimate_ in addition to (or instead of) _Original Time Estimate_ in the Issues Not Completed section. The rationale behind knowing how much time the developer estimate remains is helpful to know when you are bumping issues from one sprint to another.

There is a current open request which is still *Open* but this is confined to Version Report only:
* [Allow Version Report to show velocity based on Remaining time|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-8510]

In a nutshell, the *Remaining Time Estimate and Time Spent* should also be implemented as an option in other reports as well.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to see the Estimated Remaining Effort to be taken into account in the Sprint, Version, and Epic Reports

fields.description: We allways plan 2 or 3 sprints for every developer. Then we start first one. Sometimes happen that jira change name of second sprint and start it. This situation is described on the attached screenshot.
fields.summary: Jira is changing planned sprints and start it without permission of the administrator

fields.description: When i open sprint planning or work page I see 3 tasks from that sprint. When I want to close that sprint it says there are 6 tasks. There were no subtasks made in that sprint. Attached screenshots describes that situation.
fields.summary: I cant see all planned tasks on the Plan and Work pages in Agile module

fields.description:
h5.Steps to reproduce
# open an Issue View of an Issue that is included in an Agile board in Chrome;
# click a link to a Sprint that the Issue is in.
# a dialog box will be displayed, but the content will keep on loading infinitely. 

*Workaround*
# use the _View on Board_ link;
# right-click on the Sprint link and open it in a new tab.

Reproduced on OS X 10.6.8, Chrome 32.0.1700.107
Works fine in Firefox 26.0
fields.summary: Unable to go to a Sprint from Issue View in Chrome

fields.description:
Seen on:
- Chrome v32/Mac OSX v10.8

Steps to repro:
- Do Ctrl+Click on the issue key link (for example, to open the issue in a new tab)
- Observe that the issue is now being dragged, although you have finished the mouse up

Impact:
- When opening an issue in a new tab like this, it is easy to accidentally drag the issue to another spring/ranking position

Workaround:
- Press 'Esc' when the issue is in 'drag' state and it will return to its original sprint/ranking position
fields.summary: Greenhopper Plan Mode: Ctrl+Click on issue key link to get browser's context menu drags the issue

fields.description:
Scenario: Current Functionality

Given I am an authorized User
And I have cookies enables
And I have previously visited a GreenHopper Report for a board
When I am given a link to a specific Version Report for a board
And I click on that link
Then Greenhopper will take me to whatever the last report I visited.

Scenario: Desired Functionality
Given I am an authorized User
And I have cookies enables
And I have previously visited a GreenHopper Report for a board
When I am given a link to a specific Version Report for a board
And I click on that link
Then Greenhopper will take me to the specific Version Report provided as a URL parameter in the link.

Note, if Cookies are disabled, then the functionality will work as expected when I am logged in.
fields.summary: As a user who has a link to a specific board and report, I would like the link to take me to that report, so that I can view the report easily

fields.description:
Chrome

Originally was in Review column showing avatar. Dragged the card to the In Progress column and the assignee avatar disappeared.
fields.summary: Work mode: Moved issue in columns made assignee avatar disappear

fields.description:
When requesting a security audit, a large stack trace appears in the 'epic' area of the screen.

To replicate: 1) Go to https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/SECCOUNCIL/Requesting+a+security+audit 
2) Then clicking the "simply click here" link. Near the top of the page in the text
3) Scroll down to the 'epic' area

Note that the issue disappears if you attempt to submit the form but it is rejected (for example, without a title).

Stack trace was copied to https://paste.atlassian.com/view/14049
fields.summary: Stack Trace on EACJ
Remove Clone Prefix for Starwood Instance Ondemand
Alignment issues in the type-ahead for filters

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-10393].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce
# View an issue in JIRA that exists on an Agile Board.
# Choose More > Agile Board.

You'll get a spinning wheel for a while, then this partially-rendered dialog:

!agile.png!

I can reproduce easily under JIRA 6.2-OD-09-036 and JIRA Agile 6.3.7 (the current versions in OnDemand as of 17/2).

Only occurs when web resource batching is on (i.e. does not occur in Dev environments).

h3. Work-around

There is no work-around.

h3. Additional Info

It seems to work if the sprint is in more than one board. In that situation, upon clicking on the link, it would ask the user which board he/she would want to view it in. Clicking on these boards here would work
fields.summary: More > Agile Board results in spinning wheel followed partially-rendered dialog

fields.description:
I would like to define a user defined colour to each swimlane within JIRA Agile (including the background if possible). This should not be dependant on any query or ticket type. This should be a freely definable colour.

The idea behind this is to create a better over view of the stories within a sprint. Please see the attached screenshot of how we do this in our "non-digital" board which we of course want to replace with JIRA Agile.

Please see the screen shot attached for how we currently work and what require of JIRA Agile.

Thanks in advance and keep up the good work.
fields.summary: Define colour of swimlanes in Jira Agile
Issues types with external icon urls don't appear in the Issues in Epic panel

fields.description:
We would like the ability to have our swimlanes based on the rank of the story in the sprint.  I thought that the "Swimlanes by Stories" would do this for us, however it behaves... strangely.  It appears to be based on whether or not the Story has a subtask, which is not always the case for us.

In the spirit of KISS, we simply want the stories in the Work board to have their own swimlanes and for those swimlanes to be ordered by rank.
fields.summary: Swimlanes by Rank (regardless of sub-task)

15 - MAG3110
40 - TMP 102
40 - TSL2561
fields.summary: Solder parts for ArduSat kit

fields.description:
I've been using the boards for a while now and the limitation of only being able to create new backlogs at the bottom of the planning board is really irritating. Granted the general order of issues/features does not often move drastically during a project but so many projects are run where work is gradually broken down as it closer to development, this occurs in whichever methodology your using.

As a user, I'd like the ability to create a new sprint in between current sprints in the Jira Agile plan view, i.e. have "Create Sprint" links next to each "Start Sprint" links in the plan view. As of Jira Agile 6.3, you can only create new sprints at the bottom of the plan view.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like the ability to create a new sprint in between current sprints in the Jira Agile plan view.

fields.description:
It is not possible to create a link out of a scrum board to Confluence. The application links are configured right, and i did the configuration again but it makes no difference. The rights of the users are ok, and everything works ok but this still not.

Thank you for so far.
fields.summary: Linked Pages not available

fields.description:
Currently we do the following to add the issue to the sprint:
1. Browse to issue in issue navigator
2. Click "View of Board" link under Agile section
3. Select Board from pop-up
4. Right-click issue and send to the desired sprint

Fewer steps would be desirable.

A good way would be using a drop down box with auto-suggest and Ajax update on the "Future Sprint:" field (see attached screen caption.)
fields.summary: Add a drop down select box to set the Sprint on a story/task/bug

fields.description:
We are using Jira + Jira Agile (On Demand)

When users in our marketing group create a story, the epic link is set (I verified this myself) but when the story is saved, the epic link is left blank.

* User experiencing problem (sharonnewman) is in the following groups:

fields.description:
The VCI project has 4 Agile Boards that correspond to the Issue field “Release Vehicle” as shown below.  All four board are differentiate by filters associated with them, they are extremely simple.  
Project = VCI AND “Release Vehicle” = <Release Vehicle> ORDER BY Rank ASC.

We have four expected values for “Release Vehicle”
•	Unallocated
•	Major Release
•	Tech Release
•	Hotfix
All new issues by default go to the Unallocated Release Vehicle and in turn to the Unallocated Agile Board/Backlog as configured by the JIRA team.  The Rank value is working properly (ranking to bottom of backlog) when the issue is created from the Unallocated Agile Board page or any JIRA page other than our other 3 Agile Boards.  When the issue is created while the user is viewing the VCI Major Release, Tech Release or Hotfix Agile Boards, the issue goes to the Unallocated Agile Board but has a rank value from the Agile Board the user is viewing.  This seems like a bug.  Also when issues are moved between boards, they are not ranked to the bottom of the new board, they maintain the rank from the previous board.  This is probably by design.

Two critical requests/questions to preserve integrity of Agile Boards backlog ranking for VCI project:
* Can we configure the system such that if we are creating an issue for the VCI project while viewing an Agile Board other than VCI - Unallocated, it always gets ranked to the end of the VCI – Unallocated Agile Board (874)?
* When we change the Release Vehicle of an issue, for example from Unallocated to Major Release, the issue carries over with the rank from the Unallocated (previous) Agile Board, causing it to be ranked inappropriately.  The desired behavior is for it to show up at the end of the backlog it’s moved to.  In this example the issue may have had a rank of 222133 in the Unallocated Agile Board, and when moved to the Major Release Agile Board it will maintain rank 222133, when that rank places it towards the top of the Major Release Agile Board.
 
Regards,
Amit Singh
fields.summary: Issue order changed when issue moved from Agile Board to Another Board

During JIRA Agile (GreenHopper) installation, the custom fields added are created in the default locale. Since JIRA supports I18N, it would be nice to have JIRA Agile to also support internationalisation.

h3.Workaround
The field names and descriptions could be modified using the following steps:
# Unlock the locked field - [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]
# Edit the field to the required label - [Configuring a Custom Field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA061/Configuring+a+Custom+Field]
# Remember to again lock the unlocked fields to avoid modifications.

Note: The custom field names may also need to be updated to the new language text in other features like filter queries.

fields.description:
As a Scrum product owner I need themes to structure the backlog for a better overview of the backlog.

The description of Mike Cohn clearifies, that Themes should be, whald Eipcs are at the moment: a grouping for User Stories (and Epics):
"Finally, “theme” is a collection of user stories. We could put a rubber band around that group of stories I wrote about monthly reporting and we'd call that a “theme.” Sometimes it's helpful to think about a group of stories so we have a term for that."
(http://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/stories-epics-and-themes)

Acceptance criteria:
- There is a new Issue Type: "Theme"
- Themes are used like Epics today (v6.1): They filter the backlog (User Stories and Epics) and are displayed in an extra column. There is no need that they are affected by quick filters.
fields.summary: Use Themes to filter the backlog

fields.description:
As a Scrum product owner I want to find Epics in my Product Backlog in the same list as User Stories, so that I have an overview of the complete backlog and know which parts of it have to be broken down.

Acceptance criteria:
- Epics are displayed in the list of user stories and are filter and sorted just like the stories
- If I click on the epic, the User Stories underneath will be shown
- Epics have a different look than User Stories (colour, Symbol,...?), so that I can visually distinguish them from User Stories
fields.summary: Epics are not filters - Display Epics in the product backlog like User Stories

fields.description:
As a scrum product owner I need to see the details (description, estimation, comments,...) of epics so that I can inform me about the epic and understand better, what the Epic is about.

Acceptance criteria:
- If I click on an Epic in the left column of the agile planning board, it's details will be shown in the right column of the board.
- The epic detail view looks and behaves like the User Story detail view.
fields.summary: Display Epic details on Agile Planning Board

fields.description:
As a scrum product Owner I habe the need, that Epics are affected by filters as  User Stories are so that I only see big User Stories (called Epics), that belong to the filtered backlog.

Acceptance criteria:
- After I have choosen a quick filter on the agile planning board, in the left column  of the planning board only the epics display, that match to the current filter
- If I deselect a quick filter or no filter is selected, all (open) epics of the backlog will be displayed
fields.summary: Filter Epics like User Stories

fields.description:
As a Scrum Product Owner I need better support for Epics on the agile planning board, so that I can structurize my product backlogs in a useful matter.

To better understand the (correct?!) usage of epics, see the definition that Mike Cohn gave us:
"So, “epic” is just a label we apply to a large story. Calling a story an epic can sometimes convey additional meaning. Suppose you ask me if I had time yesterday to write the user stories about the monthly reporting part of the system. “Yes,” I reply, “but they are mostly epics.” That tells you that while I did write them, I didn't get the chance to break most of them down into stories that are probably small enough to implement directly."
(see: http://www.mountaingoatsoftware.com/blog/stories-epics-and-themes)

Given this description, Epics should be used just like user stories, at least on the planning board:
- They should be displayed in the backlog between user stories
- they should show / group their sub User Stories 
- they should be affected by filter as User Stories are
- they should display their details (description, estimation, comments) like User Stories do
fields.summary: Correct usage of Epics and Themes on Agile Planning Board

fields.description:
h5.Summary
Although we allow users to start Sprints with a Start Date in the past, that information isn't recognized in reporting.

h5.Steps to reproduce
# create a new Sprint and add Issues to it;
# start the Sprint - pick a Start Date in the past;
# see the Burndown Chart and the Sprint Report - no Issues are considered to be in the original scope, and all appear as added at the moment when the Sprint was actually started.

*Expected behaviour:* intuitively, one could assume that the selected Start Date will be resembled in reporting.
At the same time, Issue history does include the information that they were added to the Sprint after the Start Date, so technically, the report is right.

This could be addressed with one of the two solutions:
- make reporting recognize past Sprint Start Dates as the dates when Issues were added to Sprints;
- disable the option to set the Start Date in the past altogether.
fields.summary: Recognize past Sprint Start Date in reporting
